fix.description: This type is used when fixing a bug or issue in the code.

feat.description: This type is used when adding a new feature or functionality to the project.

docs.description: This type is for changes related to documentation only. This includes updates to README files, comments in code, etc.

perf.description: This type is used when making improvements related to performance optimizations.

test.description: This type is for commits related to adding or modifying tests (unit, integration, or UI tests).

style.description: This type applies to changes that do not affect the functionality of the code, such as formatting changes (e.g., indentation, whitespace, or semicolons).

refactor.description: A code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature

chore.description: This type is for general maintenance tasks, such as updating dependencies, build scripts, or configuration files. It’s used when changes don’t impact the app's functionality or code quality.

build.description: Changes that affect the build system or external dependencies (example scopes: gulp, broccoli, npm)

ci.description: Changes to our CI configuration files and scripts (example scopes: Travis, Circle, BrowserStack, SauceLabs)
